sourceDesc.p: The origin of the lexicon is in a thoroughly elaborated txt version of Dillmann, Christian Friedrich August. Lexicon linguae aethiopicae, cum indice latino. Adiectum est vocabularium tigre dialecti septentrionalis compilatum a W. Munziger. Lipsiae: Th.O. Weigel, 1865.
Additional records were created by the project TraCES (ERC Advanced Grant, Grant Agreement 338756) and follow-up projects at HLCEES

Sources include also Sylvain Grébaut, Supplément au lexicon linguae aethiopicae de August Dillmann: (1865) et édition du lexique de Juste d'Urbin (1850 - 1855), Paris: Imprimerie Nationale, 1952 and Wolf Leslau, Comparative Dictionary of Geʻez (Classical Ethiopic): Geʻez-English, English-Geʻez, with an Index of the Semitic Roots, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz, 1987

encodingDesc.p: A digital edition of the Lexicon in TEI.

entry.sense: n. similitude, likeness , ዘያስተርኢ፡ በአምሳለ፡ እግዚአ፡ ብሔር፡ ወበግብረተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ኀበ፡ ፍጥረተ፡ ዓለም፡ ትምስልት፡ ‘ which therefore appears... in the likeness of God; and with the workmanship of the body (it is) in the likeness of nature of the world ’ 234-235 (ed., tr.)
